commonroad_crime.measure.acceleration package

Submodules

commonroad_crime.measure.acceleration.a_lat_req module

class commonroad_crime.measure.acceleration.a_lat_req.ALatReq(config: CriMeConfiguration)

Bases: CriMeBase

The required lateral acceleration necessary for collision avoidance at TTC.

  • from Sec.5.3.8 in Jansson J, Collision Avoidance Theory: With application to automotive collision mitigation.

PhD Thesis, 2005, Linköping University, Linköping, Sweden.

clcs: CurvilinearCoordinateSystem
compute(vehicle_id: int, time_step: int = 0)

Specific computing function for each measure

ego_vehicle: DynamicObstacle
measure_name: Enum = 'required lateral acceleration'
monotone: Enum = 'positive monotonic'
other_vehicle: Union[Obstacle, DynamicObstacle, StaticObstacle, None]
rnd: Union[MPRenderer, None]
visualize()

Visualize the result, which will be measure-dependent.

commonroad_crime.measure.acceleration.a_long_req module

class commonroad_crime.measure.acceleration.a_long_req.ALongReq(config: CriMeConfiguration)

Bases: CriMeBase

The required longitudinal acceleration measures the longitudinal acceleration required to bring the relative velocity to zero at the time of the collision.

  • from Sec.5.3.5 in Jansson J, Collision Avoidance Theory: With application to automotive collision mitigation.

PhD Thesis, 2005, Linköping University, Linköping, Sweden.

clcs: CurvilinearCoordinateSystem
compute(vehicle_id: int, time_step: int = 0)

Specific computing function for each measure

ego_vehicle: DynamicObstacle
measure_name: Enum = 'required longitudinal acceleration (aka deceleration rate to avoid crash)'
monotone: Enum = 'negative monotonic'
other_vehicle: Union[Obstacle, DynamicObstacle, StaticObstacle, None]
rnd: Union[MPRenderer, None]
visualize()

Visualize the result, which will be measure-dependent.

commonroad_crime.measure.acceleration.a_req module

class commonroad_crime.measure.acceleration.a_req.AReq(config: CriMeConfiguration)

Bases: CriMeBase

The required acceleration based on the longitudinal and lateral values.

  • from Sec.5.3.10 in Jansson J, Collision Avoidance Theory: With application to automotive collision mitigation.

PhD Thesis, 2005, Linköping University, Linköping, Sweden.

clcs: CurvilinearCoordinateSystem
compute(vehicle_id: int, time_step: int = 0)

commonroad_crime.measure.acceleration.dst module

class commonroad_crime.measure.acceleration.dst.DST(config: CriMeConfiguration)

Bases: CriMeBase

https://criticality-metrics.readthedocs.io/en/latest/time-scale/THW.html the deceleration that has to be applied to a vehicle to maintain a certain safety time

clcs: CurvilinearCoordinateSystem

monotone: Enum = 'positive monotonic'
